result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Allan Erickson

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:16 AM Defendant Daniel Allan Erickson in court.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Daniel Allan Erickson.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad appeared by Zoom audio only for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Brewer only appointed on 22CF16, not 22CF55 yet.  Court questions Atty Brewer.  Atty Brewer asks def to contact PD office.  PTC to be scheduled in 22CF16 at 11:50 a.m.  22CF55 to track with this case.  Can be pretried same date if Atty Brewer is appointed.  Initial Appearance adjourned in 22CF55 to allow def to get atty and temporary waiver of time limits for prelim.  Nothing further.  Adj.  9:19 a.m.  klr
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:04 a.m.  BOR as def called in.  Court calls case.  Def appears via phone.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def indicates Heidi Brewer is his atty in other case.  Admits made error in date.  Court quashes warrant.  Def to contact Public Def to retain counsel.  Case to be scheduled for 10/24 at 9:00 a.m.  Address is current.  Adj.  11:06 a.m.  klr

9:39 AM Defendant Daniel Allan Erickson not in court.   Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court asks DA request.  DA requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.  Body only.  Adj.  9:40 a.m.

9/6 BOND HEARING MINUTES:  10:22 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Def is currently on bond in other case.  Possible bail jumping charges.  PC hearing today.  Right to atty explained.  Initial App to be set for 10/3 at 9:00 a.m.  Def indicates Heidi Brewer is atty in other case.  DA has no specific bond request.  If cash, small cash requested.  Court questions def re:  bond conditions.  Court sets $1,000 sig bond for new case.  Def indicates address is current.  Court sets same bond conditions as 22CF16 but not to be present in any bars and def to submit to random PBTs.  Adj.  10:28 a.m.  klr
